result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Courtney Rose Lagerstrom

records.addlTxt:
11:40 AM Cases 22CF117 and 22CM152 called together.  Defendant Courtney Rose Lagerstrom in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Courtney Rose Lagerstrom.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: programming possible and would affect the offer, requesting additional status 30 days out.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:14 AM Cases 22CF117 and 22CM152 called together.  Defendant Courtney Rose Lagerstrom in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Courtney Rose Lagerstrom.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case 22CM152 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Case 22CF117 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Bond to cover Burnett County cases 22GF242 and 22CF117.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

Case on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State e-files information mirroring the criminal complaint.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
